answerText: A Coney Island of the Mind[10] A Coney Island of the Mind is by this jazz-influenced American Beat poet, who co-founded the City Lights bookstore. He was prosecuted on obscenity charges after he published Allen Ginsberg's "Howl."
heading: Dragoon |2013 | 2 | 15 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One of its poems describes a woman who comes up to the speaker but has bad teeth and "really hates poetry." [10] Name this collection whose title comes from Henry Miller's Into the Night Life. It contains the poems "I am waiting" and "Constantly risking absurdity."
